result.execSummary:
The defendant Tina M Carr-Eklund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution of $7933.47 to River Mills Senior Housing in the City of Watertown
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--no gambling of any kind
--no presence in any gambling establishments including casinos, bingo halls, race tracks, or similar facilities 
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency:  Watertown PD

The Court indicates that if the Department of Corrections is agreeable, the Court has no objection to transfer of the Probation term to the State of Louisiana. 

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tina M Carr-Eklund

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
case called at 8:43am. 
Defendant Tina M Carr in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney Zarwell indicates that Ms. Carr has married and her last name is now Carr-Eklund.  
The Court orders the new married name added to the case. 

On Motion of the State, the Court amends the charge in the Information to Class I Felony "Theft from a Business Setting greater than $2500 but less than $5000" contrary to Statute 943.20(1)(b) and (3)(bf). 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified--ADA Beck submits a victim impact statement; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
recess 8:48am, reconvene 8:51am. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Ms. Carrie Carr-Eklund, the Defendant's spouse, makes a statement.  
Defendant Tina Carr-Eklund makes a statement. 

The Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Carr-Eklund on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--no gambling of any kind
--no presence in any gambling establishments including casinos, bingo halls, race tracks, or similar facilities 
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as required by the Agent
--to pay resitution of $7933.47 to River Mills Senior Housing in the City of Watertown
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

The Court indicates that if the Department of Corrections is agreeable, the Court has no objection to transfer of the Probation term to the State of Louisiana. 
Days credit for time already served:  0 days
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given.
recess 9:05am.
Proposed STAO for continuance of the 10/24/14 Arraignment

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 8:38am.
Defense Attorney David Zarwell appears in court. Defendant Tina M Carr appears by telephone.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court recites the information set for in the Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form. 
Ms. Carr waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
ADA Beck files the Information; Attorney Zarwell admits service of the Information.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. 
Ms. Carr verifies that the Thibodaux, LA address is current. 
recess 8:44am. 

NEXT: schedule Arraignment (likely plea/sent) on 10/24/14 at 9:00am. (this date was set to accomodate Defendant's out of state travel)
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 9, 2014 at 01:40 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tina M Carr
Current: 178 Lake Accardo Ave., Thibodaux, LA 70301 United States  (Effective: 06-16-2014)
Prior: 178 Lake Accardo Ave, Thibodaux, IA 70301

Defendant Tina M Carr in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
Upon motion of the State, the Court amends complaint to show state of residence as "LA" not "IA" and to correct dates - Pg2, Pgh2 from "9/18/14" to "9/18/13" and Pg3 1st full pgh. from "1/10/13" to "1/10/14*

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No presence in any bingo hall, casino, race track or similar facility
-Not engage in any gambling
-Booking at JCSD 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 7/9/14 at 1:40 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule STC/Preliminary Hearing August 4, 2014 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Initial appearance on June 16, 2014 at 10:45 am.
